result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. SPENCER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

MOTION TO VACATE DEFERRED JUDGMENT AGREEMENT
Defense is in agreement to DJA being vacated.   Court grants the motion and enters judgment of conviction on count 1, injury by negligent use of weapon.  Court orders defendant to give DNA sample.  
Plea date and sentencing reset to 11-19-15 at 9:00 a.m.   
Minutes.
Motion hearing set for 10-06-15 at 1:30 p.m.
DOC Balance Inquiry
Ann Larson, public defender.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail after Revocation of Probation.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

Defendant in custody.   
MOTION TO VACATE DJA as to Count 1 
Parties agree to adjourn the motion to vacate the DJA for today as the defendant has other pending matters and this motion will be addressed with the other cases.  
SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION as to Counts 2 & 3
Defendant is before the Court for sentencing, his probation having been revoked effective 04-15-15.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, on each count, concurrent, with credit for seventy-seven (77) days time served.  Court orders the court obligations converted to a civil judgment.

BAIL MOTION - 
Attorney Lambrecht asks that the condition of bail be modified to no assaultive contact with Dawn Spencer and Payton Spencer and that the defendant be allowed to return home.

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2nd degree reckless endangerment and injury by negligent use of dangerous weapon.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-25-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with Payton Spencer and Dawn Spencer or the residence at 720 N. 5th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
